.
Compensation Payable for Paired Organs Under 38 CFR 3.383
Even if only one ear is service-connected (SC), compensation may be payable under
38 CFR 3.383
for the other ear, as if SC, if the Veteran’s hearing impairment
is compensable to a degree of 10 percent or more in the SC ear, and
meets the provisions of
38 CFR 3.385
in the nonservice-connected (NSC) ear.
Important
:  When the above entitling criteria do not apply for the NSC ear, the hearing in the NSC ear should be considered normal for purposes of computing the SC disability rating.
Reference
:  For more information on compensation payable for paired SC and NSC organs, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 7.A
.
